SEARCH
Package Src.Entity

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Src.Entity.Entity
Src.Entity.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class Player extends Entity implements Observer
Class Player that contains fields for handling animation frames, storing sprite images for different directions, and references to the game panel and key handler for input processing.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(GamePanel gp)
      Constructor class Player Initializes a player object with the specified parameters, including the game panel, key handler, and title manager. Sets the initial position, size, and other properties of the player.
      Parameters:
      gp - The GamePanel instance to which the player belongs.
      keyH - The KeyHandler responsible for handling player input.
      mapManager - The TitleManager providing map-related Methodality.

  • Method Details

    • InitPlayer

      public void InitPlayer()
      Initializes the player by creating sprite vectors, loading player images, and setting up initial parameters such as speed, sprite index, and collision area. Assumes the existence of player sprite images in specific directories.

    • getPlayerImage

      public void getPlayerImage()
      Loads player sprite images for different directions (front, back, left, right). Populates the respective vectors with image resources for animation.

    • HandlePlayerInput

      public void HandlePlayerInput() throws IOException
      Method to manage the direction of player
      Throws:
      IOException

    • Update

      public void Update() throws IOException
      Method to updates the player's position and sprite based on user input and game logic Handles movement in four directions (up, down, left, right) and sprite animation
      Throws:
      IOException

    • Draw

      public void Draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Method to draws the player on the provided Graphics2D object.
      Parameters:
      g2 - The Graphics2D object on which the player will be drawn.

      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - The observable object that this observer is registered to
      arg - The argument passed to the `notifyObservers` method
